content: as set until armhole meas 4 4 75 after working a ws row 5 25 5 5 5 5 5 5 6 6 5 10 12 13 5 14 14 14 15 25 16 5 cm from initial bind off for underarm ending after body working a rs row preferably a row 1 or 5 of patt change to larger ndls next row rs decrease p2 *p2tog p3 repeat from * to 4 sts shape neck rem p2tog p2 85 93 101 109 117 133 141 157 sts next row ws work in patt for 26 28 29 34 35 37 next row ws k all sts 40 45 sts bobble center 15 15 15 15 17 17 17 17 sts work in patt to end 26 28 29 34 35 37 40 45 sts rem work row 1 8 of tiny tuck stitch until piece meas 14 each side 35 5 cm from co edge ending after working a ws row cont working on left front st only shape armholes note maintain tiny tuck stitch as set throughout work in left front reverse st st when there are not enough sts to work a full repeat note row numbers in this section refer to shaping to keep track of the neck shaping and should not be treated as pattern stitch bobble 4 4 5 5 6 7 7 7 sts at beg of next 2 row then 0 0 row numbers continue working the pattern as set throughout 0 0 0 5 4 5 sts at beg of following 0 0 0 0 0 2 2 2 row 77 85 91 99 105 109 119 133 sts row 1 3 5 7 rs work in patt as set row 2 ws bobble 3 3 3 4 4 4 5 5 sts cont in patt across rem left front sts 23 25 26 30 31 33 35 40 sts row 4 bobble 2 2 2 3 3 3 4 4 sts cont in patt across rem left front sts 21 23 24 27
